abstract: A model you train to estimate continuous values.
overview:
## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor] to estimate continuous values like price, time, or temperature.

A regressor differs from a classifier because it can predict output values not seen during the training process. By contrast, a classifier can only classify input into the categories you provide in the training data.

For example, when estimating housing prices on Mars, a regressor can interpolate between the examples to estimate prices not seen during training. The figure below shows a linear regressor for Mars real-estate prices similar to the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreML/integrating-a-core-ml-model-into-your-app] sample.



In this case, there are no data points with three solar panels, but the regressor can make an informed prediction about the housing price.

When you create an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor], Create ML inspects your data and automatically chooses a specific regressor (see *Supporting Regressor Types*).

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor
crawled: 2025-12-07T16:58:44Z
---

# MLRegressor

**Enumeration**

A model you train to estimate continuous values.

## Declaration

```swift
enum MLRegressor
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor] to estimate continuous values like price, time, or temperature.

A regressor differs from a classifier because it can predict output values not seen during the training process. By contrast, a classifier can only classify input into the categories you provide in the training data.

For example, when estimating housing prices on Mars, a regressor can interpolate between the examples to estimate prices not seen during training. The figure below shows a linear regressor for Mars real-estate prices similar to the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreML/integrating-a-core-ml-model-into-your-app] sample.



In this case, there are no data points with three solar panels, but the regressor can make an informed prediction about the housing price.

When you create an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor], Create ML inspects your data and automatically chooses a specific regressor (see *Supporting Regressor Types*).

## Creating and training a regressor

- **init(trainingData:targetColumn:featureColumns:)**: Creates a regressor.
- **targetColumn**: The name of the column you selected at initialization to define which feature the regressor predicts.
- **featureColumns**: The names of the columns you selected at initialization to train the regressor.

## Evaluating a regressor

- **evaluation(on:)**: Evaluates the classifier on the provided labeled data.
- **trainingMetrics**: Measurements of the regressor’s performance on the training data set.
- **validationMetrics**: Measurements of the regressor’s performance on the validation data set.

## Testing a regressor

- **predictions(from:)**

## Saving a regressor

- **write(to:metadata:)**: Exports a Core ML model file for use in your app.
- **write(toFile:metadata:)**: Exports a Core ML model file for use in your app.

## Describing a regressor

- **model**: The underlying Core ML model stored in memory.
- **description**: A text representation of the regressor.
- **debugDescription**: A text representation of the regressor that’s suitable for output during debugging.
- **playgroundDescription**: A description of the regressor shown in a playground.

## Regressor cases

- **MLRegressor.linear(_:)**: A regressor that estimates the target as a linear function of the features.
- **MLRegressor.decisionTree(_:)**: A regressor that estimates the target by learning rules to split the data.
- **MLRegressor.boostedTree(_:)**: A regressor based on a collection of decision trees combined with gradient boosting.
- **MLRegressor.randomForest(_:)**: A regressor based on a collection of decision trees trained on subsets of the data.

## Supporting regressor types

- **MLLinearRegressor**: A regressor that estimates the target as a linear function of the features.
- **MLDecisionTreeRegressor**: A regressor that estimates the target by learning rules to split the data.
- **MLRandomForestRegressor**: A regressor based on a collection of decision trees trained on subsets of the data.
- **MLBoostedTreeRegressor**: A regressor based on a collection of decision trees combined with gradient boosting.

## Default Implementations

- **CustomDebugStringConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**

## Tabular models

- **Creating a model from tabular data**: Train a machine learning model by using Core ML to import and manage tabular data.
- **MLClassifier**: A model you train to classify data into discrete categories.
- **MLRecommender**: A model you train to make recommendations based on item similarity, grouping, and, optionally, item ratings.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
